While I was sounding the alarm on #Covid_19, President Trump was encouraging companies to *increase* exports of medical supplies‚Äîas recently as the beginning of March. 

This and more in my new report on the Administration's catastrophic mismanagement ‚¨áÔ∏è‚¨áÔ∏è

Census Day was last week, but for those who still haven‚Äôt filled out their census forms, remember to count every person in your household‚Äîincluding young children. This will help ensure kids in our communities get the resources they need. https://t.co/fo6ce1SiVO

Oversight üëèüèº shouldn‚Äôt üëèüèº be üëèüèº political üëèüèº

This is a stark reminder of the importance of the Congressional Oversight Commission, which is not part of the executive branch. We have a shot at real accountability, but we need to act quickly. https://t.co/h4p2chwkY3

The President should have started using the Defense Production Act weeks ago, across our economy. If he had, we wouldn‚Äôt be choosing between export bans and global partnership. Another unforced error that will cost lives. https://t.co/VVmoPb6gay

Wellness Matrix Group told consumers their product was ‚ÄúFDA vetted and approved‚Äù‚Äîeven
 though the FDA hasn‚Äôt approved ANY at-home COVID test. @CongressmanRaja and I have launched an investigation, but our work isn't done. I'm staying on the case and seeing this through. https://t.co/pDUkxYpGTy

ICYMI: I am hosting a live virtual town hall on my Facebook page TODAY at 1:00PM PDT!

Head over to https://t.co/ZEUCod6rk4 to tune in üì∫

BTW, one of the reasons the already-too-high number of families in medical debt will skyrocket is because this Administration has failed to make COVID-19 *treatment* free for Americans who need it. Of course, the President continues to lie about this, too. https://t.co/hZoNxtN94C

As this pandemic threatens to crush more and more Americans with medical debt, @CFPBDirector is pushing policies that put patients‚Äô private medical information at risk. I‚Äôm following up to demand answers for American families‚Äîrepeated sidestepping is simply not good enough. https://t.co/Zw0p7Yhsd2

A message from my daughter Betsy and me for #CensusDay2020. Fill out your census, then RT to encourage your friends and family to do the same! #GetCounted

(I can confirm it‚Äôs quick, easy, and fun for the whole family üë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶) https://t.co/iB0m10uLxZ

https://t.co/rXJVBjuEyw

This isn‚Äôt about playing politics. Especially during a crisis, the American people need to have confidence that our government is doing right by their families.

That‚Äôs why I‚Äôve asked for a spot on the Congressional commission that oversees the $500 billion corporate bailout. https://t.co/ng1ROiwbAf

Today may be April Fools' Day, but it's also Census Day of Action. An accurate #2020Census count will ensure our communities get their fair share of federal funding‚Äîthat's no joke! It's quick and easy to do online, over the phone, or by mail. More here: https://t.co/RFFdsKEGnZ
Correction: it‚Äôs completely believable because the Trump Administration appointed a former coal lobbyist to lead the @EPA. https://t.co/71J8cawq4D

It‚Äôs unimaginable that during a public health crisis, @EPAWheeler is bowing to special interests like Big Oil by stripping environmental protections that will hurt our ability to **breathe**. I'm leading my colleagues in fighting back against this reckless proposal ‚¨áÔ∏è‚¨áÔ∏è https://t.co/NtXUhy6wS3

Working Americans are the backbone of our economy. On #CesarChavezDay, let's send appreciation to the frontline workers who are working tirelessly to help us stay healthy and safe, and keep in our thoughts the Americans who are out of work due to this pandemic.

I called on dialysis companies @Davita and @Fresenius to lay out plans for clear patient safety standards, transportation, and home dialysis. Companies charged with patient care cannot take a back seat in this crisis, and I won‚Äôt let them. https://t.co/u4Nayhei3U

Dialysis patients are some of the most vulnerable in our population, and they have to leave their homes 3x a week for treatment. @Davita & @Fresenius need to do everything they can to protect patients they serve‚Äîsomething they've failed to do in the past. https://t.co/WqPbUVCJuf

This crisis has been especially hard on our state, but I‚Äôm glad to see @CAgovernor continuing to show strong leadership in his response. I remain committed to being a partner at the federal level to keep California safe during this pandemic‚Äîwe‚Äôre all in this together. https://t.co/CHo2uvAiFt
RT @CAPAC: The #Census2020 is available in 12 languages at https://t.co/J0x82JKoef and there are languages guides in 59 languages here  htt‚Ä¶
You can find more information about the census here: https://t.co/RFFdsKWhMz

I hope you‚Äôll take the time to read/watch this piece about how important the census is for our communities.

Then, make sure you and your neighbors all fill out the census to make your voices count (literally)!

https://t.co/lZZX7ym6Ke

Grateful for the chance to nerd out with @CBSNews for this piece. Though it didn‚Äôt make the cut, I was also asked how this gets me so fired up. Here‚Äôs how: businesses, governments, and everyone in between use this public treasure to serve our communities. https://t.co/lZZX7ym6Ke

Until Amazon steps up to do their part to help our front-line health care workers and emergency responders, I won't let up. Now is the time for corporate America to show up and give back some of the vast profits they built off the backs of American workers. #DemandAmazonPay https://t.co/sBrdjr0tne

As a consumer advocate, I‚Äôve seen my fair share of corporate mumbo jumbo meant to confuse and deflect. I asked @JeffBezos to use some of the company's vast resources help the American people during this challenging time, and @amazon failed to deliver. https://t.co/UnP0Baxjxx
RT @TheLastWord: Trump released a statement that he would not abide certain oversight provisions in the coronavirus relief bill. @RepKatieP‚Ä¶

With $500 billion of taxpayer money on the line, the American people should learn about oversight of this corporate bailout as breaking news, not on the History Channel. This money could go out the door within hours‚Äîwe need watchdogs NOW. https://t.co/RYoB56wHXC

I support the CARES Act, a relief package that will bring critical resources to help families and small businesses in our community. I will be providing more information about this bill to you and will continue to work with our community and my colleagues to address the pandemic.
My COVID-19 test came back negative, which is a relief. I am still staying home, because I have symptoms and need to recover; this means I will not be able to travel to Washington, DC to vote.

California families' top priority right now should be staying safe and healthy. I applaud Governor Newsom for securing a commitment from financial institutions that they'll work with consumers to provide necessary relief. Watch me explain ‚¨áÔ∏è‚¨áÔ∏è https://t.co/hux5O6GFic

It's *almost* astonishing that companies are so eager to make a quick buck that they'll skirt FDA regulation and buy up limited testing supplies to market unapproved at-home testing kits. @CongressmanRaja and I are investigating. The American people deserve answers. https://t.co/1fIbOZQCxZ
P.S. My children are so far healthy and handling things well, and I did make sure to wear a mask! https://t.co/y4wiRL9RHG

I will remain in self-quarantine until I have the test results back and until directed by my doctor that it is safe for me to leave my home. I am participating by telephone in Congressional business and listening to the concerns of our Orange County community. (4/4)

Over the weekend, I had a fever over 100.4 degrees. As instructed, I continued to isolate in my bedroom and phoned my provider. I carefully followed all instructions to visit my doctor and received a test for COVID-19. I am waiting for results. (3/4)
Last week, I developed cold-like symptoms followed by fatigue. I stayed home and spoke to my healthcare provider. (2/4)
When I was elected, I committed to being transparent and accountable. I have kept that promise throughout my time in Congress. (1/4)

Price gouging during this national public health emergency is absolutely repugnant. We've all got to step up and hold companies accountable to keep Americans safe, and I'm glad to see state Attorneys General taking this on. https://t.co/e10JnHCRkX

I‚Äôm proud of my work on behalf of Orange County families and the American people, but there is still much, much more work to be done. My promise is to keep fighting hard, holding this Administration accountable, and delivering results. (18/18)

Paid leave will keep communities safe, as people feeling unwell can stay home. I‚Äôve written about why it‚Äôs important that any subsequent legislation to address #COVID_19 mandates comprehensive paid leave for Americans working for large employers. (17/?) https://t.co/p5WlYnnVjo

I‚Äôve studied families struggling to make ends meet; I know that a lot of Americans need help quick. As Congress continues to work on providing coronavirus relief, I‚Äôve pushed for every person to get $1000 a month, to put workers before corporations. (16/?) https://t.co/X2qWaho9gW

We know that our seniors are facing additional challenges in dealing with this pandemic. I secured a provision in @FSCDems coronavirus relief legislation that would support service coordinators helping older adults. (15/?) https://t.co/5WD05TuRs4

When the President announced that he was going to ‚Äúinvoke‚Äù the DPA, I didn‚Äôt take him at his word‚ÄîI dug in. I found out that the Administration doesn‚Äôt have policies in place to execute or coordinate orders placed under the DPA, so I called for answers. (14/?) https://t.co/FG2gUOEq4v

Americans need to know that critical supplies are on the way and that these contracts aren‚Äôt lining the pockets of the President‚Äôs family members or cronies. I secured language in House legislation that would increase transparency of the DPA. (13/?) https://t.co/ecPvy4xV7p

The federal government can use the Defense Production Act to get healthcare providers the supplies they need. I joined @RepAndyLevin and colleagues on both sides of the aisle to lead a resolution calling on the President to actually use the DPA. (12/?) https://t.co/mS9axjMKI4

Congress needs to be able to do its job without endangering public health‚Äîthere is no reason to make 400+ people fly into Washington to gather in the same room. I‚Äôve been at the forefront of the movement to instate remote voting during this crisis. (11/?) https://t.co/cNNIHcezel

With many communities facing increased restrictions on public gatherings, I‚Äôve shared tips for how we can protect public health and live our lives, especially for those of us with young kids. (10/?) https://t.co/fFYqlwMGGS

Along with @RepMalinowski, I‚Äôm protecting consumers by demanding answers about a new COVID-19 triage website. Big Tech shouldn‚Äôt be profiting off people‚Äôs personal data, especially when Americans are busy staying safe during a pandemic. (9/?) https://t.co/OCdiwqA9Vr

The backbone of our economy is working families‚Äînot corporate special interests. I stood up to @USChamber when they requested an exception to give companies access to their employee‚Äôs private medical records. (8/?) https://t.co/5mHshZwj0j

To continue to keep our community up to date on public health guidance and what I‚Äôm doing for Orange County families, I hosted a telephone town hall with UCI Public Health Professor Andrew Noymer to answer questions directly from #CA45 residents. (7/?)

The lack of urgency by the Trump Administration has been a consistent theme of their response. I led over 80 of my colleagues to call on federal health agencies to cut through red tape and get our academic medical centers off the sidelines. (6/?) https://t.co/ol7gEEn7Rb

When I didn‚Äôt hear back, I confronted the CDC Director in a hearing and asked him again to use his authority to make testing free for those who need it. It took 5 minutes, but I was able to get him to commit‚Äîunder oath‚Äîto do this. (5/?) https://t.co/eLaqrMqBji

Along with my colleagues @RepUnderwood and @Rosa_DeLauro, I wrote a letter to call on the Trump Administration to use its existing authority to make #COVID_19 testing free for any American that needs it‚Äîregardless of insurance. (4/?) https://t.co/5FNgTbvYQA

One of my top responsibilities as a Congressmember is to keep #CA45 residents informed about the facts. That‚Äôs why I produced a FAQ on the coronavirus outbreak and have been updating it regularly since January. (3/?) https://t.co/bzFDuVnfS8

When Orange County had one of the first confirmed cases of coronavirus in the United States, I immediately sent a letter to the CDC. At the time, I was one of a few federal officials calling for us to prepare for this now-pandemic. (2/?) https://t.co/oPzBbpfHhN

I‚Äôve taken #coronavirus seriously from Day 1. Today marks 8 weeks since I pushed the CDC to brief Congress on the threat posed by #COVID_19. Since then, I‚Äôve been working around the clock to address this crisis. Here‚Äôs some of what I‚Äôve been up to: (THREAD)

The Administration says it's placing orders under the Defense Production Act, but it seems that @HHSGov doesn't have policies in place to execute those orders or coordinate them with agencies like @FEMA. @RepSpanberger, @RepAndyLevin, @RepSherrill, and I are want answers. (2/2) https://t.co/wbQP3n45Re

As a consumer protection attorney who fought big banks, I know to read the fine print‚Äîso that‚Äôs what I did when the President said he was invoking the Defense Production Act. Turns out the Administration never finalized the rules for ordering emergency medical supplies. (1/2)
To read more about my bill to help our older adults during the #CoronavirusPandemic, visit my website here >> https://t.co/LM2DcxJMOU

RT @OversightDems: Knowledge is power ‚úäüèΩ

Over the last 2 wks, @OversightDems have been working tirelessly to hold telephone & video town h‚Ä¶

I won‚Äôt take the President‚Äôs word for it that he‚Äôs ‚Äúinvoked‚Äù the DPA. Our healthcare providers and the public need to know that masks, ventilators, and other critical supplies are on the way‚Äîand that the President isn‚Äôt passing out contracts to his family members and cronies.

My proposal would give the American public access to information related to how the Defense Production Act is used, like:

üìÑ items ordered (quantity and type)
üìÑ delivery dates
üìÑ names of manufacturers

The Defense Production Act allows the federal government to mobilize industry during a national security emergency. A provision I wrote, included in @FSCDems #COVID_19 legislation, would require all orders placed under the DPA to be made public.

In addition, I‚Äôm proud to see #CA45 businesses like @MasimoInnovates working hard to make sure patients can get the care they need through innovative new medical technology.

https://t.co/3bpAS2rMHE

We in Orange County are so fortunate to have excellent universities and cutting-edge research in our own backyard. I‚Äôm glad to see @UCIrvine at the forefront of potentially life-saving innovation.

https://t.co/STqRxy2GGR

These last few weeks have been hard on our community, but in the midst of this difficult time I want to take a second to recognize some of the really important, collaborative work coming out of Orange County on the front lines of the fight against #COVID_19. ‚¨áÔ∏è‚¨áÔ∏è

Taking this crisis seriously means mobilizing our industrial capacity to meet the needs of our healthcare workers. This Administration‚Äôs inaction has made Congressional action necessary, and I‚Äôm proud to join @RepAndyLevin & colleagues on both sides of the aisle to get this done. https://t.co/IPgxcq1vxt

As a single working mom, I have to juggle‚ÄîI couldn‚Äôt do it without a childcare provider. As the #COVID_19 pandemic continues to take kids out of school and after this emergency has passed, let‚Äôs take time to thank our nation‚Äôs #childcare providers, who make the juggling possible.
And for more information from the State of California, visit this website: https://t.co/FfAuCizaaG

Strictly sheltering in place is one way we can all take care of each other during this uniquely stressful time. It's the least we can do for all of our brave healthcare workers, grocery store employees, and others who don't have the option to stay home. Be safe!

There is no reason to freak out, but we do need to take the shelter-in-place order seriously. If you don't need to, don't leave the house, unless you're going on a hike or a run. Being outside to get some fresh air is totally fine!

These jobs are also exempted from shelter in place: healthcare operations, grocery stores, food banks, convenience stores, gas stations and auto repair shops, banks, hardware stores, plumbers, electricians, laundromats, garbage collection. Full list HERE>> https://t.co/gaiJzRjpuY

Here are some essential tasks: caring for our seniors, minors, dependents, and people with disabilities; caring for a family member in another home; getting supplies like food and medicine; and going to the doctor.

It is *not* inherently dangerous to be outside. My sons will continue shooting hoops in the driveway, and my daughter Betsy and I will continue our outdoor yoga. We just need to stay at home unless it's *necessary* to leave.

I know the #Covid_19 news is overwhelming for many in our community, so I wanted to explain @GavinNewsom's statewide shelter-in-place order. The summary: it's not as scary as it sounds. Read this thread to learn more.

This is a difficult new reality for our state, but one that will undoubtedly save lives. Thankful for @GavinNewsom‚Äôs courage in these times. Wishing we had this kind of leadership in the White House. Learn more about the Governor's directive ‚¨áÔ∏è‚¨áÔ∏è https://t.co/FfAuCizaaG
This is wrong and needs to end. It‚Äôs past time that we reform our broken political system that puts corrupt politicians ahead of working families. https://t.co/p0ugMNulcP
RT @RepMalinowski: "The coronavirus will prey not just on the health of Americans but their financial wellbeing. In its next bill respondin‚Ä¶

I‚Äôm glad that party leadership is finally taking the idea of remote voting seriously after two Members tested positive for #Covid_19. I‚Äôve been calling for this since last week‚Äîbefore these reports‚Äîbecause we need Congress to have continuity of operations. https://t.co/6w628DcqFv

The #COVID_19 crisis highlights why we need comprehensive paid sick leave is. Nobody should go to work sick‚Äîputting other employees and the public at risk‚Äîbecause they won‚Äôt otherwise be able to put food on the table.

Read my op-ed with @RepMalinowski ‚¨á
https://t.co/p5WlYnnVjo
@AndrewYang Couldn‚Äôt agree more. That‚Äôs why I‚Äôve been calling for this since last week ‚¨áÔ∏è‚¨áÔ∏è  https://t.co/W7tE8xScx8

So today, with @rosadelauro, I told @USChamber that we will not sit idly while they make requests that would devastate worker protections for our most vulnerable communities. Read more here >> https://t.co/9G9I3Pofuc

Our Congressional stimulus package ought to support families and small businesses. The @USChamber thinks it should be a boon to large corporations.

I'm standing up for working Americans and against this giveaway to special interests.

When it comes to social distancing and public health best practices, Congress should be an example, not an exception.

So @RepSwalwell, @RepVanTaylor, and I are leading a group of 50+ Reps. to call on leaders of both parties to allow remote voting, so we can keep doing our jobs. https://t.co/s9sGY3TMi9

People are concerned about paying their bills and staying safe during this pandemic‚Äîthey shouldn‚Äôt also have to worry about companies profiting off their personal data.

@RepMalinowski and I are conducting oversight of the tech giant behind a new #Covid_19 triage website. https://t.co/OCdiwqA9Vr

And as a consumer advocate, I know how important it is for us to have accurate information, so I also asked Mr. Bezos to label the types of hand sanitizer (with lower than 60 percent alcohol content) that won‚Äôt be effective in killing the virus.

We all have a role to play in combating #Covid_19. @amazon has the capacity to save hundreds of thousands of lives by redeploying its vast resources creatively. I‚Äôm asking CEO @JeffBezos to redirect its stock of face masks and sanitizer to help hospitals fill shortages. https://t.co/Fjz90i7bKj

I worked on the foreclosure crisis and saw firsthand the need for a stimulus that helps working Americans. We need immediate relief, and that starts with sending all Americans $1,000. @SenatorRomney, let‚Äôs come together, across the aisle, and get this done. https://t.co/LzjAd4JlNK

My work in Congress wouldn't be possible¬†without a dedicated staff. Behind every hearing is research, creativity, expertise, and hard work. During this crisis, even more than usual, we need committed public servants. I‚Äôm thankful for my entire team today and every day. https://t.co/75xmW3fyue

UPDATE: @JetBlue removed the ad and is now offering up to 14 days of paid leave for workers. I commend them for their efforts to support public health, but ‚Äúup to‚Äù 14 days is vague. All major corporations can and should provide 14 days of paid leave for all employees. Full stop. https://t.co/SJwlyWRhNq

I promised to keep #CA45 residents up to date about what‚Äôs happening with the coronavirus outbreak. Tomorrow, I‚Äôm hosting a telephone town hall with UCI Public Health Professor Andrew Noymer to share the latest information and answer questions about COVID-19. More info here ‚¨áÔ∏è‚¨áÔ∏è https://t.co/Pfy4XEDhPD

RT @CAgovernor: The #2020Census invitations have been mailed! 

This is the first census that will be primarily online. That means you can‚Ä¶

I was elected to do a job that includes voting on policies to help working families. Remote voting would enable Congress to do its job during this public health crisis & model the behavior we‚Äôre asking of businesses. Leaders of both parties should act now to get this done. https://t.co/7QnXzEU75I

For those who haven't been following along, I highlighted the issue with these census scams in a hearing with the Census Director last month and also called on him to do something about this. WATCH >> https://t.co/x6HXKYSYiP

While I'm disappointed this was even being done in the first place, I'm glad that @GOP has announced they'll stop the deceptive mailers. This is why I conduct aggressive oversight: to protect everyday Americans and our shared institutions like the census. https://t.co/Z4kdvFC7iY

Please keep in mind that unless you have severe symptoms, you should not go to the hospital or a doctor's office, as healthcare facilities are overwhelmed. If you have mild or moderate symptoms, self-quarantine for 14 days.

Yesterday, @CDCDirector committed to making #Covid_19 diagnostic tests free for everyone who needs them. Now he‚Äôs trying to break that promise, and I won‚Äôt allow it. So today, I called on @CDCGov to provide clarity and a recommitment.

More here >> https://t.co/oQ7lfXqJe7

The Administration isn‚Äôt acting with the urgency this issue deserves. So, I‚Äôm leading over 80 of my colleagues in calling on @US_FDA and @HHSGov to issue guidance allowing academic medical centers to support the rest of the medical community in preventing the spread of #Covid_19. https://t.co/2lFE6awV3d

I want to be clear. Medical professionals are advising that unless you have serious symptoms, avoid going to the hospital/doc‚Äôs office. Stay home. We don‚Äôt currently have the capacity to test healthy people, and going to the hospital puts people at risk. https://t.co/EdBqjlRLMT

This is a gross message to send, @JetBlue. The precautions the CDC is recommending, like teleworking and social distancing, will save lives, but not if abused by corporations looking to make a buck. This isn‚Äôt the time for jokes that downplay the seriousness of this pandemic. https://t.co/XZ8KvowoUT

I did the math: a full battery of coronavirus testing costs at minimum $1,331.

I also did the legal research: the Administration has the authority to make testing free for every American TODAY.

I secured a commitment from a high-level Trump official that they‚Äôd actually do it. https://t.co/RmolCtmNbG

These 2 @WellsFargo board members resigned before coming to our hearing today, but the remaining members have no business taking over the helm. I had a simple question for outgoing directors: is presiding over major scandals a qualification to be on the Wells Fargo board? https://t.co/jcFNJ6u1eX

In a hearing today, I asked why 1/3 of tellers rely on public assistance to make ends meet, when @WellsFargo made $20 billion in profit last year.

CEO Charlie Scharf apparently wasn't even sure the bank was profitable! He only said he "believes" it is. üëÄ https://t.co/X7SW3eOaKH

.@WellsFargo owes 1.7 million consumers about $350 each for bogus fees on auto loans. In a hearing today, I explained what happened and called on CEO Charlie Scharf to make this right.

WATCH (featuring a graph, a court filing, and even a movie reference) >> https://t.co/Tcf7qOQBWf

Will stop spread of coronavirus:
‚úÖ washing your hands
‚úÖ staying home if you‚Äôre sick

Won‚Äôt stop spread of coronavirus:
‚ùå racism
‚ùå xenophobia

Delete this tweet, @GOPLeader. https://t.co/hd6VX3RuHo

Wishing a very bright and cheerful #Holi to all who are celebrating in Orange County and beyond! During the festival of colors, we celebrate the arrival of spring and the triumph of good over evil‚Äîit is so heartening to see such beautiful displays of festivity and joy.

This week, President Trump asked Congress, by tweet, to support the Land and Water Conservation Fund. I am 100% behind this, but it seems the biggest roadblock to getting this done will be the President himself, as his 2021 budget cuts @EPA by 26% and slashes millions from LWCF. https://t.co/VBCB5WWsz8

Knowing if you have COVID-19 can help keep you, your family, and our community safe. We need to be equipped with the best tools and knowledge to fight this coronavirus, and the cost of diagnostic testing cannot be a barrier.

So I took action. Last night, I led an effort with @Rosa_DeLauro and @RepUnderwood to demand that the Administration take action to make these tests affordable for everyone, including those on private plans.

To learn more about our effort, read here: https://t.co/5FNgTbvYQA

I refuse to put patients‚Äô health at risk so that insurance companies can use COVID-19 to pad their profits. Patients with private insurance shouldn‚Äôt have to choose between lab tests for this virus and putting food on the table.

The same day Administration officials briefed Congressmembers and told us that everyone who needs to can get tested for the coronavirus, we see news like this. So were we lied to, or does the Administration not understand the scope of what we‚Äôre dealing with? https://t.co/dI7XPeioc0
Now do fake political ads. https://t.co/AGm0zQqotS

I also backed $8.3 billion in emergency funding today to combat the spread of the coronavirus, which includes:
‚úÖ $1 billion for medical supplies for providers,
‚úÖ $3 billion for R&D,
‚úÖ $950 million for state agencies, and
‚úÖ $300 million to increase vaccine affordability.

Orange County families want results, not rhetoric. So this afternoon, instead of listening to Vice President Pence talk about the Administration's failed attempts to stop the coronavirus, I held a call with OC hospital leaders on the frontlines of this fight. https://t.co/pIePuh4USp

There‚Äôs no excuse for the Senate‚Äôs failure to pass legislation to finally allow the Department of Health & Human Services to negotiate for #LowerDrugCosts. People are struggling, and this is how we can help them. https://t.co/NWbRuK1csJ

California, today‚Äôs the day to make your voice heard! As a reminder, you can still register to vote at your polling place; just bring your state-issued ID and last 4 digits of your SSN. Polls close at 8PM.

Find a polling location near you ‚¨áÔ∏è‚¨áÔ∏è https://t.co/IgZAuL3UeS

I was so excited for the chance to visit Esplanade Elementary in Orange to donate books from the Library of Congress and spend some time with our future leaders. As an educator and a mom, I‚Äôm committed to encouraging a lifelong love of reading in our children. #EsplanadeStrong https://t.co/QAsa6I9W08

Let‚Äôs be clear about the stakes here: if the Affordable Care Act is struck down, millions of Americans could lose health insurance. I'm proud that the House and our state of California are leading the way to protect patients. https://t.co/DDLMzxs3Uo

Paid leave is good for our economy and our workers, but it also helps to keep our communities safe during disease outbreaks and every year during flu season. This is a no-brainer: we should all support paid leave. https://t.co/L6stOsKdog
